txt.en: You have come outside of your home in town to find the snow worse than any weather you have seen in this part of Rohan.
Instance: The Day the Giant Came
Ask Ludeca about the snow
'What in the world was that??\n\n'Gifemund, will you go look? You have experience in arms....'
You have come outside of your home in town to find the snow worse than any weather you have seen in this part of Rohan.
'What in the world was that??\n\n'Gifemund, will you go look? You have experience in arms....'
'This winter is something....'
You have come outside of your home in town to find the snow worse than any weather you have seen in this part of Rohan.

'You are pale as a ghost, Gifemund! Whatever is it?'

You explain to your worried neighbours about the terrible force of menace and the blinding cold you felt north-west of the village.

'We should evacuate! Whatever terror approaches, I do not like it!'
'I have never seen snows like this before!'
You have come outside of your home in town to find the snow worse than any weather you have seen in this part of Rohan.

'What is it, Gifemund?? Why does the earth shake?'

You hastily tell Léofburg to gather warm cloaks, food, and water, and meet at Herethryth's farm.

'I will do as you say, but...if we leave town, we shall all die of cold!'
'Nay. Nor I.'
The rumbling came from north-west of town.\n\nYou should search for the source of the rumbling.
'O what will become of us? I am slow, but I will try to keep up.\n\n'Thank you, dear Gifemund, for coming to warn me! I am so afraid!'
'What is this madness?'
Ludeca is in Dunfast.\n\nYou should speak with Ludeca.

'I will be out to meet you shortly, Gifemund! I will not be much longer.\n\n'Between you and me, old friend, I have never been so afraid in my life! This unnatural winter has had me on edge, but...but this is worse....'
'The air -- it doesn't feel right....'
Something evil bears down on Dunfast.\n\nYou should ensure that everyone has evacuated their homes.

'Only cowards flee their homes. Fight alongside me, Gifemund, and drive the enemy back!'\n\nGifemund now recalls that he was still chilled by the icy power just outside of Dunfast. A heated argument between the two neighbours ensued, and Forthere became obstinate.
Forthere's house is on the outskirts of Dunfast.\n\nYou should break into Forthere's house.
Forthere is in his home in Dunfast.\n\nYou should convince Forthere to evacuate immediately.
A terrible rumbling shakes the earth
The rumbling sounded like it came from near the windmill
You have entered your own home
Ask Ludeca about the snow
You find that you have not the will to go further. You are too afraid, brave though you are....
Forthere's home is locked, as always. It is best to come back when all else is done.
Listen to your neighbours
Get everyone out! Something evil bears down on Dunfast.
Forthere, beaten, was carried out and evacuated with the others....
Talk to Ludeca
Léofburg reluctantly agrees to meet outside of Dunfast
Search near the windmill for the source of the rumbling
You fear for your elderly neighbour, but an uncertain fate in the frozen wild is better than certain death in Dunfast
Tell Ludeca of the terrible force north-west of Dunfast
Evacuate everyone! ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
You have gathered some meagre belongings, but you feel a great urge to keep moving
Break the lock to Forthere's home
The unearthly chill in Iothete's home reminds you that Iothete rarely comes here anymore. You hope that he is safe.
Convince Forthere to evacuate
Ludeca is terrified of the sudden change of weather in Dunfast, as terrified as you are yourself
'The weather brought you out of your warm home as well, did it?\n\n'A little snow never bothered anyone, but this is indeed strange.'
You have come outside of your home in town to find the snow worse than any weather you have seen in this part of Rohan.
A terrible rumbling shakes the earth
'The weather brought you out of your warm home as well, did it?\n\n'A little snow never bothered anyone, but this is indeed strange.'
